intro: Oxydectes neuwiedii, commonly known as the Neuwied's oxydectes, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender, branched stems and opposite leaves. Its flowers are usually clustered in terminal spikes, displaying vibrant colors that attract pollinators. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain environments.
